page.title: 05TYMAWR CONVENT,LYDART
page.content: Tymawr Convent,the home of the Society of the Sacred Cross,is a contemplative community of Anglican nuns. Four nuns came to Tymawr in 1923;there are now eighteen working within the convent and on sixteen acres of land. Life in the community is based on a regular round of prayer,work,rest and recreation. The Sisters work hard at farming,gardening,printing and butter and cheese making. The daily celebration of the Holy Eucharist is central to the life of the convent,and the recitation of the Divine Office takes place in a series of services during the day. Guests are welcomed at the convent and guesthouse at Michaelgarth. Some come for a holiday,others to make a retreat or study in the peaceful surroundings. Many guests help with the manual work around the convent.
